basics.name: Sarah Mitchell
basics.label: Secondary Science Educator
basics.summary: Dedicated and passionate science educator with 8 years of experience teaching Biology and Chemistry to secondary students. Committed to fostering scientific curiosity and critical thinking through inquiry-based learning and hands-on laboratory experiences. Proven track record of improving student engagement and academic achievement in both IB and AP curricula.
basics.objective: Seeking a position as a senior science teacher at an innovative international school where I can leverage my expertise in IB curriculum delivery and laboratory program development to inspire the next generation of scientific thinkers while contributing to curriculum innovation and teacher mentorship programs.

work.name: Boston International Academy
highlights: * Led department-wide initiative to integrate inquiry-based learning, resulting in 25% improvement in student engagement scores
work.summary:
• Teach IB Biology HL/SL and Chemistry SL to grades 11-12, maintaining 92% student pass rate with 68% achieving scores of 6-7
  • Developed and implemented comprehensive laboratory program aligned with IB internal assessment requirements
  • Serve as IB Science Department Coordinator, leading curriculum development and teacher training for team of 6 educators
  • Mentor new teachers and provide ongoing professional development in inquiry-based pedagogy and IB assessment standards
  • Established virtual laboratory program during COVID-19, ensuring continuity of hands-on learning experiences

work.name: Lincoln High School
highlights: * Increased AP Biology pass rate from 65% to 84% over three years through targeted intervention and differentiated instruction
work.summary:
• Taught AP Biology, Honors Biology, and General Science to grades 9-12, serving diverse student population including ELL and special education students
  • Redesigned curriculum to align with NGSS standards, emphasizing cross-cutting concepts and scientific practices
  • Collaborated with special education department to develop accommodations and modified assessments for students with IEPs
  • Coordinated school-wide Science Fair, engaging 200+ students in authentic scientific research projects
  • Integrated technology tools including virtual simulations and data analysis software to enhance student learning

activities.involvements:
• Founded and advise Environmental Science Club with 35 active student members, coordinating campus sustainability initiatives and community outreach projects
  • Organized and led annual 10-day marine biology field study trip to Bahamas for 20 students, providing hands-on research experience
  • Developed school-wide STEM mentorship program pairing 12th grade students with 9th graders, improving freshman science course success rates by 18%
  • Serve as Faculty Advisor for Science Olympiad team, coaching students to regional championships for two consecutive years
activities.achievements:
• IB Category 1 Workshop Leader Certification - Biology (2022)
  • Recipient of Excellence in Science Teaching Award from Massachusetts Science Teachers Association (2021)
  • Published article 'Bringing Authentic Research into the High School Classroom' in NSTA journal (2020)
  • Selected for competitive Teacher Leadership Program cohort by district administration (2019-2020)
  • Completed AP Biology Teaching Certification with College Board (2017)
  • Nominated for Teacher of the Year by student body (2018, 2022)

volunteer.summary: Valid through September 2029 | Includes SEI Endorsement for English Language Learners
Completed IB Category 1, 2, and 3 workshops for Biology HL/SL and Theory of Knowledge

awards.title: Excellence in Science Teaching Award
awards.summary: Recognized for innovative teaching practices and outstanding contribution to science education

awards.title: Teacher of the Year Nominee
awards.summary: Nominated by student body for exceptional dedication and impact on student learning
